title: "Lee Sin, Yasuo, Zed, Riven, etc. are fun, that's why they are popular"
body:
I find {{champion:101}}, {{champion:9}}, {{champion:48}}, and {{champion:30}}, to be extremely fun. Why nobody picks them, then?

Being fun is a subjective concept, so it is not a good factor to determine the reason why certain champions are popular. I find {{champion:157}} to be extremely boring, for example, even though many find him to be fun.

Also, technically winning is fun, and people want to win. People have the mentality that mobile champions have a better chance to win,, so people use them.

Also, I am sure that if you ask to many people, they will say "{{champion:45}} is boring" due to many reasons which may include lack of mobility, you have to focus on farming during the early game, and others. Yet, he is now one of the most popular champions.

Note: This thread is not meant to determine whether certain champions are OP or not.

For Xerath, I think it's because of his reliance on skill shots, especially his ult. Even with level 5 mastery on him, I still sometimes completely whiff my shots. It's not fun when you can't do your main sources of damage, something that can happen with Xerath

How did you get to level 5 mastery but not learn how to chain your abilities together?

you land your W which slows them and then chain into e, and when they're stunned (and incapable of moving) you fire your Q.

Or perhaps you lead in with E into a quick W+Q rotation.

Or you charge you Q and (paying close attention to your target), fire it from the fog of war, when they're busy doing something like auto attacking a minion.

i'm not level 5 Xerath; I've played Xerath like 4 times in my whole life and I know how to land his abilities. Xerath is 100% skillshots, but just like Lux or Zilean or Syndra or Morgana or Ahri (or Sion), their is definitely consistency in their kits if you understand how to use cc.

The only champion I find that I can legitimately whiff everything with is Ziggs, who's abilities don't set each other up as well (his E is a knockback, with like a .1 second stun at the end). However his animation speeds are fast enough that you don't really require set up.
How did you get to whatever age you are without reading comprehension?  He said if he misses his shots.  How can he land any of those aformentioned combos if he misses the shots?

He said he missed every ability sometimes-implying that he spams them without care-something that a mastery level 5 (hell a guy who played Xerath 5 times) would never do.

Literally it takes 10 minutes with Xerath before you realise that you're supposed to fish with your E or your W before you move in with your other abilities (if you land E or W, otherwise you fallback).
If they don't hit, you don't shoot. Perhaps you are incapable of reading so let me paint it nice and simple for you:

You _never_ fire all your spells at once.
You fire your E or your W, and if they land, then you fire your other hard to hit abilities.
Many other mages do this as well. For example, Lux fishes with her Q before unloading her other abilities.

The fact that Avantel is complaining about whiffing literally everything is a sign that he does not know how to properly play mages.
My point is that you should never complain about missing your entire kit. Unless you are a complete noob and have never played this game before (or games of this genre), then landing your  full kit against an enemy should not be an issue.

Also

All he said was that he 'sometimes completely wiffs my shots', this does not imply he is randomly spamming every ability like you seem to think. All it implies is that even with practice hitting skill shots is not guaranteed, which is a statement so self evident that it is hard to imagine someone arguing against it.

Have you ever thought that maybe your perception on a champion is the reason you don't think they are fun?

These are high APM champion (maybe not lee) that give you high skill ceilings that leave you feeling very gratified that you did X thing at X time.

Except a lot of them don't have skill ceilings as high as they should be, or skill floors for that matter. As an example, riven has a very low skill floor, and maybe an average skill ceiling. You can be a first time riven and get a lucky lane and still carry the game super hard. Yeah, lee sin has a fairly high skill floor, but the ceiling is not that far from it. Yasuo is in a similar position to riven, in that even if you are horrible with the champion you can still snowball if you get a lucky lane.

Yasuo is in a similar position to riven, in that even if you are horrible with the champion you can still snowball if you get a lucky lane.

So what you're saying is that if my enemy laner feeds me I can snowball and carry the game?

It goes a bit beyond that though. They have tools in their kits that means that if your enemy dies to you even just once, there's little to no coming back from it. High damage, mobility, and CC make it very difficult to passively farm a lane once they get ahead.

Fun is subjective, but the champions you listed have exciting and flashing kits, they move around a lot, they DO things, they blow up people, or out play them. None of the ones you listed are over powered (Don't even try to argue that).

And if your argument is that people just play to win, they'd pick heimer dinger or champions that have the highest win rates, Lee and Riven don't even have a 50%, and Yasuo and Zed barely even touch 50% either.

They play them because they ARE fun, Veigar isn't one of the most popular champions either compared to others, Lee sin is at a 48% play rate, while veigar barely hits 15%. (And lee sin only has about a 45% win rate).

Zed Riven Lees and Yasuos kits, ARE FUN, for most people, fun is subjective, but we all play league of legends, and generally people like to make Flashy plays or Nuke someone because its FUN. Playing a slow boring game of poke and stacking, doesn't give most the rush that destroying someone in 2 seconds does.

So yes, fun is a good factor to determine the reason why they are played a lot. Everyone is their own person, but people who have the same hobbies (IE league of legends) generally tend to think a like in one way or another :)
